intro: Senecio eightsii, commonly known as the Eights' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Senecio eightsii produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to its natural habitat.
